issue.title: Next steps for `HOMEBREW_INSTALL_FROM_API`

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
### Provide a detailed description of the proposed feature

Here are the tasks that need to be completed in order to consider `HOMEBREW_INSTALL_FROM_API` ready for official testing by maintainers and interested users:

- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/13795: `brew update` should still update core and cask taps when `HOMEBREW_INSTALL_FROM_API` and `HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER` are both set (allowing maintainers to test this and still maintain homebrew/core and homebrew/cask)
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/13815: Allow `HOMEBREW_DEVELOPER` users to use all dev commands even with `HOMEBREW_INSTALL_FROM_API` set
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/issues/137512: Migrate all casks to use `on_{macos_version}` blocks instead of `if MacOS.version` conditionals
- [x] Remove the small number of `Hardware::CPU` methods that slipped through in formulae and casks
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/14301: Improve the rubocops to catch more cases
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/14304: Update `CaskLoader` to load casks from their JSON API like we do with formulae
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/13842: I think it might be a good idea to mark in the `INSTALL_RECEIPT.json` or `.metadata` directory whether the formula/cask was installed from the API in case we run into issues and it's helpful to know how a formula was installed. But, this is a lower priority and might not even be needed at all
- [x] We need to handle download errors of the `formula.json` and `cask.json` files
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/14009
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/issues/13890
- [x] We should have a way to be notified more reliably when formulae.brew.sh updates stop working as expected because this will mean that users can not get updates and will essentially be frozen in an old state. Maybe a bot should open an issue somewhere.
- [x] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/14384
- [ ] A warning or some sort of message should be shown when installing a formula with a `post_install` block or a cask with a `{pre,post}flight` block so that users know that some things may not work at the moment (or, in the case of formulae, they need to run `brew postinstall <formula>`)
    - See https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/14026#issuecomment-1292266942 for a good solution
- [ ] https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/14412

### What is the motivation for the feature?

I'm back at school so my availability over the next several months will be much more limited and less consistent. I'm opening this tracking issue to help monitor progress over time.

### How will the feature be relevant to at least 90% of Homebrew users?

Eventually, `HOMEBREW_INSTALL_FROM_API` will be the default for everyone.

### What alternatives to the feature have been considered?

None

body: Thanks for reporting‚Äîthis is a bug we're aware of and planning on working on. To temporarily get around this until we're able to fix it, you can set the `HOMEBREW_NO_INSTALL_FROM_API` environment variable.

issue.title: Visual Studio Code 1.75.0 installation fails

repository.name: homebrew-cask
repository.description: üçª A CLI workflow for the administration of macOS applications distributed as binaries

issue.body:
### Verification

- [X] I understand that [if I ignore these instructions, my issue may be closed without review](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/blob/master/doc/faq/closing_issues_without_review.md).
- [X] I have retried my command with `--force`.
- [X] I ran `brew update-reset && brew update` and retried my command.
- [X] I ran `brew doctor`, fixed as many issues as possible and retried my command.
- [X] I have checked the instructions for [reporting bugs](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask#reporting-bugs).
- [X] I made doubly sure this is not a [checksum does not match](https://docs.brew.sh/Common-Issues#cask---checksum-does-not-match) error.

### Description of issue

Installation of Microsoft Visual Studio 1.75.0 fails with the error message

> Error: It seems the symlink source '/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/bin/code' is not there.

The `code` binary seems to be preset in the downloaded zip
```shell
$ unzip -l VSCode-darwin.zip | grep '/code$'
     1034  02-01-2023 17:20   Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/bin/code
```

Unsure whether it is related, as you can see my `brew config`, the `--app-dir` option is and point to a different path than shown in the error message above.

### Command that failed

brew install visual-studio-code

### Output of command with `--verbose --debug`

```shell
$ brew install visual-studio-code --verbose --debug --force
```

issue.title: HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS appdir not being honoured in Cask DSL

repository.name: homebrew-cask
repository.description: üçª A CLI workflow for the administration of macOS applications distributed as binaries

issue.body:
### Verification

- [X] I understand that [if I ignore these instructions, my issue may be closed without review](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/blob/master/doc/faq/closing_issues_without_review.md).
- [X] I have retried my command with `--force`.
- [X] I ran `brew update-reset && brew update` and retried my command.
- [X] I ran `brew doctor`, fixed as many issues as possible and retried my command.
- [X] I have checked the instructions for [reporting bugs](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask#reporting-bugs).
- [X] I made doubly sure this is not a [checksum does not match](https://docs.brew.sh/Common-Issues#cask---checksum-does-not-match) error.

### Description of issue

If appdir is set: HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS="--appdir=~/Applications", then all reference to appdir remains as `/Applications`.

### Command that failed

brew install macdown

### Output of command with `--verbose --debug`

```shell
$ brew install macdown
==> Downloading https://github.com/MacDownApp/macdown/releases/download/v0.7.2/MacDown.app.zip
Already downloaded: /Users/thoran/Library/Caches/Homebrew/downloads/6997abe110b2dc77023e7a133ea1024423e1dbfb09ad48b9396e9f9023bb4d4b--MacDown.app.zip
==> Installing Cask macdown
==> Moving App 'MacDown.app' to '/Users/thoran/Applications/MacDown.app'
==> Backing App 'MacDown.app' up to '/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/macdown/0.7.2/MacDown.app'
==> Removing App '/Users/thoran/Applications/MacDown.app'
==> Purging files for version 0.7.2 of Cask macdown
Error: It seems the symlink source '/Applications/MacDown.app/Contents/SharedSupport/bin/macdown' is not there.
```


### Output of `brew doctor` and `brew config`

```shell
$ brew doctor
Your system is ready to brew.
$ brew config
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 3.6.20-261-gb3a71ba
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: b3a71ba7cdb7e005c26c86bcc627f0549dfe19d0
Last commit: 14 hours ago
Core tap origin: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
Core tap HEAD: 15cc58f490ef218e460352ccd00ebf79f35b2491
Core tap last commit: 6 hours ago
Core tap branch: master
Core tap JSON: 06 Feb 06:22 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: ["--appdir=~/Applications", "--fontdir=/Library/Fonts"]
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY: localhost:0.0
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: /usr/bin/vi
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.10 => /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/2.6/usr/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 14.0.0 build 1400
Git: 2.39.1 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 7.84.0 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 13.0-arm64
CLT: 14.2.0.0.1.1668646533
Xcode: 14.2
Rosetta 2: false
```


### Output of `brew tap`

```shell
heroku/brew
homebrew/bundle
homebrew/cask
homebrew/core
homebrew/services
thoran/tap
```

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Please note that these warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers
with debugging if you file an issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is
working fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this. Thanks!

Warning: Unbrewed header files were found in /usr/local/include.
If you didn't put them there on purpose they could cause problems when
building Homebrew formulae, and may need to be deleted.

Unexpected header files:
  /usr/local/include/node/cppgc/common.h
  /usr/local/include/node/js_native_api.h
  /usr/local/include/node/js_native_api_types.h
  .......

All of following outputs are `/usr/local/include/node/...` things.
```


### Verification

- [X] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 3.6.21-67-g8cd497d
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: 8cd497d37efa812fb65576c0e233bde923e78331
Last commit: 5 hours ago
Core tap origin: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core
Core tap HEAD: 7dfbfa13ee2ded0acd69c0ace755c6fd7a09e1d2
Core tap last commit: 3 days ago
Core tap branch: master
Core tap JSON: 11 Feb 00:35 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: mvim
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8
http_proxy: http://127.0.0.1:1087
https_proxy: http://127.0.0.1:1087
Homebrew Ruby: 2.6.10 => /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/2.6/usr/bin/ruby
CPU: octa-core 64-bit arm_firestorm_icestorm
Clang: 14.0.0 build 1400
Git: 2.39.1 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 7.86.0 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 13.2-arm64
CLT: 14.2.0.0.1.1668646533
Xcode: 14.2
Rosetta 2: false
```


### What were you trying to do (and why)?

`brew install android-platform-tools`

### What happened (include all command output)?

```
==> Downloading https://dl.google.com/android/repository/platform-tools_r34.0.0-darwin.zip
Already downloaded: /Users/sunner/Library/Caches/Homebrew/downloads/948acd36b36543709f021d280a0ad06ac1afb947fe984d798051d073514b36d2--platform-tools_r34.0.0-darwin.zip
==> Installing Cask android-platform-tools
==> Purging files for version 34.0.0 of Cask android-platform-tools
Error: It seems the symlink source '/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/adb' is not there.
```

### What did you expect to happen?

The android-platform-tools should be installed.

I tried `brew info android-platform-tools`,  the output is:
```
==> android-platform-tools: 34.0.0
https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools
Not installed
From: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/blob/HEAD/Casks/android-platform-tools.rb
==> Name
Android SDK Platform-Tools
==> Description
Android SDK component
==> Artifacts
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/adb (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/dmtracedump (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/etc1tool (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/fastboot (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/hprof-conv (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/make_f2fs (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/make_f2fs_casefold (Binary)
/usr/local/Caskroom/android-platform-tools/34.0.0/platform-tools/mke2fs (Binary)
==> Analytics
install: 14,774 (30 days), 43,048 (90 days), 186,523 (365 days)
```

All of the artifacts are prefixed by `/usr/local/`, but my `brew --prefix` is `/opt/homebrew` and `brew --caskroom` is `/opt/homebrew/Caskroom`.

I also checked the cask code at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/blob/HEAD/Casks/android-platform-tools.rb
, it is well coded by using `staged_path`

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
brew install android-platform-tools
```

body: @Rylan12 Although I'm assigned here: if you beat me to a PR, go ahead! Mine still isn't working locally yet.

issue.title: Overhaul Formula/Cask JSON generation

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

labels.name: critical
labels.description: Critical change which should be shipped as soon as possible.

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
Take a slightly hackier but more reliable method of setting up `$HOMEBREW_PREFIX`, `$HOME` and `--appdir`.

- Use constants for placeholders
- Monkeypatch to set `HOMEBREW_PREFIX` consistently to placeholder
- Use environment variable to set `Dir.home` consistently to placeholder
- Use `appdir` short-circuit to set `Cask#appdir` consistently to placeholder
- Use `Cask.generating_hash!` to enable "generating mode" with these patches
- Fix `Formula#caveats` from JSON

See https://github.com/Homebrew/formulae.brew.sh/pull/744 for the formulae.brew.sh side.

Fixes #14505
Fixes #14595
